title: Differentiated Learning Design to Improve Numeracy Literacy and Mathematical Self-Concept in Students with Special Educational Needs

context.prior_knowledge: Basic special education theory for primary levels and foundational knowledge of mathematics pedagogy
context.additional_context: Strengthening the capacity to design differentiated mathematics education strategies applicable in special education settings, targeting undergraduate students in medical, legal, and technical professional fields.

learning_goals: Participants can explain three or more specific tools for assessing numeracy literacy levels in students with special needs.
Participants can design differentiated instructional strategies to enhance mathematical self-concept tailored to students' individual needs.
Participants can develop and apply two or more smartphone-based numeracy education activities in blended learning environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
